21;"Five Ways to Sharpen Your Sense of Humor and Improve Your Relationships by Mike Moore";"sharpenhumor";"

Humor has long been considered one of the most effective tools to judge the quality of any relationship. If there is laughter present you can be sure the relationship is a healthy one. When the laughter ceases the relationship is on the down slide. If you want to have more fulfilling relationships you might want to consider sharpening your sense of humor as a great place to start.
Here are five ways to improve your sense of humor and improve your relationships in the process.

1. Begin to cultivate an atmosphere of humor and laughter in your relationships by focussing on the funny things in life and enjoying the laughter they evoke. Soon you will be seeing humor all over and enjoying it fully.
2. If you don â€™t laugh as much as you used to and want to correct the situation start associating with humorous
column2: fun loving people and avoid the downers.

column1: 3. Learn to laugh at yourself. If you donâ€™t you leave the job to others. So many people are unable to laugh at themselves because of their own insecurities and fears. We are afraid to look foolish in the eyes of others and appear to be incompetent. It is important to realize that we all make mistakes and when we do a good laugh makes the mistake seem trivial and human.
4. Collect cartoons and jokes and put them on display on the fridge or the bulletin board for all to see and enjoy. Make sure to avoid racist
column2: sexist or filthy humor. There is plenty of good clean humor to go around without resorting to these. Remember that there is a difference between dirty and earthy humor. I personally like earthy humor. I donâ€™t appreciate dirty material.

column1: 5. Use humor to neutralize conflict in your relationships. When things get tense use self deprecating humor to lighten things up. I remember one evening having an argument with my wife
column2: Carol. In the heat of the moment she said something totally out of character. She said something hurtful. In my surprise I looked at her and said
column4:
when you say things like that you stoop to my level.\" She started to laugh and so did I. It wasnâ€™t long before things were back to normal.
Remember that a sense of humor is learned
column5: not inherited. You can sharpen your sense of humor if you really want to. When you do
column6:
you will find that your relationships become richer and more rewarding and that people find you more attractive and fun to be with. This alone makes improving your sense of humor worth the effort.

71;"Como hacer las torres de Hanoi en Visual Basic";"Como hacer las torres de Hanoi en Visual Basic";"

Este articulo lo escribi en mi segundo semestre de carrera en electronica en el IEST. En la clase de lenguaje de programacion II nos encargaron escribir un programa en Visual Basic que resolviera el problema de las torres de Hanoi. Despues de un rato de pensar halle la forma de resolver el problema y escribi mi programa. Resulta que muchos de mis companeros estaban teniendo problemas haciendo el programa y (segun yo) como no tenia tiempo de ayudar a todos
column2: escribi este documento que explica como hacerlo. Creo que despues de todo me tarde mas escribiendo el documento de lo que me hubiera tardado ayudando personalmente a cada quien.
en este articulo escribo de una forma un poco presumida como si quien lo estuviera leyendo no fuera tan inteligente. Mi intencion no era ofender a nadie
column3: solo estaba tratando de ser un poco chistoso y sarcastico. Este estilo de escritura lo tome de unos articulos escritos por un tal \"kiwidog\" (creo que ese era su pseudonimo) los cuales hablabam sobre como crear tu propio 3D engine. Y pues como aquel articulo hablaba mucho sobre algebra lineal
column4: trigonometria y geometria analitica
column5: el autor pensaba que los lectores eran mensos
column6: lo cual no es el caso para nada.

73;"Advanced Topics in MOSFETs";"Advanced Topics in MOSFETs";"

Este articulo es el proyeto final de mi clase de EE339 (Solid State Electronics). Tenemos que leer 4 articulos de investigacion que hayan sido publicados por maestros de la Universidad de Texas en Austin en el area de los transistores MOSFET.
El trabajo consiste en escribir una resena sobre cada uno de los articulos. La resena debe mencionar el proposito
column2: los metodos experimentales y los resultados de la investigacion. Tambien debemos mencionar como dicha investigacion afecta el rendimiento de los MOSFET
column3: cuales son las promesas de dicha investigacion
column4: y que obstaculos se deben superar para lograr dichas promesas.

column2: ya elegi dos articulos del profesor Kwong. Uno habla sobre el uso de materiales dielectricos con \"high-K\" (alto coeficiente dielectrico) para poner como insulador entre el gate (la compuerta) y el susbtrato de silicio.

column1: El otro articulo habla sobre la movilidad de los electrones de germanio en silicio tensado (strained-Si) en MOSFETs con cuerpo ultra-delgado. Todavia no lo leo asi que no se onda.

So smile

column2: Iâ€™ve felt my eyes like drowning

column2: Iâ€™ve felt mi face like frowning

column1: Yet I tell myself again

Something inside me floods me with sadness

Yes

That the most beautiful giftâ€¦. of Lifeâ€¦.
So smile!!

79;"Tears of the Sky";"by Ana Nieto";"

Tears of the Sky
by Ana Nieto

I was looking down at my muddy feet as I was walking toward the cliff. It was raining in my eyes as it was in the sky.  I stopped at the cliff and lifted my eyes from the dirty ground. Through the rain I saw a boy who was sitting in the mud
column2: his face was resting on his knees with his little arms around his legs.  He was a boy like me.  I kept walking towards the cliff and passed by him.  When  I was about to take that last step of my life off the edge of the cliff
column3: he lifted his arms quickly and with his cold white tiny hands he grabbed my hand in his and pulled it to his chest. \"Please...\" he said
column4: \"Please... donÂ´t.\"

column1: I looked down at him
column2: puzzled. His face was covered with blood and the rain had spread it all over his face. I noticed something that amazed me; he was crying blood. I kneeled down beside him
column3: something about him seemed very familiar. It was as if I was bound to him someway
column4: somehow. Why would he stop me from jumping off the cliff? Why would he save me? I wondered
column5: confused.

column1: I felt a cool breeze that made me shiver while he looked at me. His big blue eyes widely opened and shone like crystals while a sea of sadness filled his frowned little face. Even when we seemed to understand each other with our eyes
column2: there was still a mystery that troubled me. Silence reigned the earth in those moments.  The boy then hugged me. He was holding onto something. He was holding not onto me
column3: but onto my life. He was holding it tight
column4: as if he did not want my life to go away
column5: nor to end. His tears slid all the way down to my shirt
column6: but strangely my shirt wouldnÂ´t stain with the blood of his tears. Then
column7: I found out something else; his skinny body was filled with wounds.

column1: A horrible thought struck my head. How could have I done such a terrible thing? At that moment it was all clear for me. Why would I steal his life filled with oportunities? Why would I take away from him the joy of seeing the sun rise another day

column1: In that very instant of life I understood him in his grief

column1: Streams of hard work ran through my face. I was tired. Tired of life and all it had made me go through. I was on my knees
column3: deliberating whether I should stand up or not. â€œMaybe I should stay here a little longer
column4: â€ I said to myself
column5: but a â€œlittle longerâ€ went by and I was still on my knees.

column2: and the road had been rough. The rocks on the road were treacherous
column3: killing my feet. I had fallen other times
column4: but they had never been as intense as this one. To stand up and continue the journey seemed to be the hardest thing in the world
column5: yet it was the one and only thing I craved the most. To be sure
column6: this accomplishment required much more than hollow words. It required heart and mind.

column1: I was weakened by the obstacles on the road. My weary soul had gone through so much! Getting this far had not been easy
column2: and falling like this had not been hard. I felt I had no strength left. I felt alone. I felt betrayed by my own will and denied any determination. To stand up and continue
column3: now seemed more distant than ever it did before. I couldnâ€™t go any farther
column4: my heart
column5: my body
column6: my mind
column7: wouldnâ€™t let me. â€œI canâ€™t take it anymoreâ€ I said to myself. Yet another part of me awoke and said: â€œDonâ€™t give up! You can do it.â€

column1: At that point it became very challenging to choose what to do. I was confused. To give up sounded so easy
column2: yet something inside me wouldnâ€™t allow it. I looked up to the sky
column3: deep into the eyes of God
column4: hoping to find myself in the blink of an eye. Not surprisingly
column5: I was still on my knees. I realize Iâ€™m not the only one who feels inundated by failure. I know I am the only one who CAN continue.

column1: Instead of focusing on my misery
column2: and adding to the sorrows pooling inside of me
column3: I held my head up high. High as if nothing had happened
column4: as if I had never fallen. I restrained the â€œbutsâ€ and the â€œcanâ€™tsâ€
column5: and didnâ€™t allow them to rule in my mind
column6: anymore. As I lifted my head I saw a hand in front of me
column7: offering help and bringing my heart new hope that colored my face with a smile. So I grabbed that helping hand and stood up. I realized that it was hard indeed
column8: but no one said it would be easy. I also realized that there was really no one there
column9: except in my imagination. All the negativeness and difficulty had only existed in my mind. I was up again and had overcome my challenge.

column1: I continued my way through life
column2: and though Iâ€™ve had many falls
column4: I will always remember that day I fell. Even when I felt I couldnâ€™t go on anymore
column5: when situations couldnâ€™t be worse
column6: I held my head up high and challenged life no matter how hard it seemed to be.

column2: I look up to the sky
column3: and I realize I am not alone. So I remember the day I fell
column4: but not as the day I fell; but as the day I rose.

                                          Waiting...

Sometimes itâ€™s a deep melancholy

You know that Iâ€™ll be waitingâ€¦

column1: Same as every day!

162;"Desperate is the one crying for help";;"

(Written on Nov 19th 2008)
Do you ever feel like crying
Like this strange feeling of uncertainty
Desperate is the one calling for help
A heart that cannot help but
No reason to feel this way
I can not take this feeling away?
Itâ€™s a spine crawling its way deep
Such a feeling that wonâ€™t let me sleep
I just wish I could trust
I just wish I could know
Day by day letting me know
The day to be over so the next would come
Because I know and feel that
Timeâ€™s slipping away from my hands
I want to scream and stop it
At least take a grasp of it
For although it goes so slow
I know Iâ€™ve never felt so much like this
Iâ€™ve been so lost now in the blink of time
Not just what Iâ€™m leaving behind
As long as I search for

column15: happiness and indescribable love. The kind you know with no doubt that you would give your life unconditionally.

column1: Imagine being 18 years old and feeling that youâ€™ve lived through quite some experiences. Youâ€™ve tried your best and are relative mature --- yet you know you still have a long way to learn and need to mature much more--- and that life has actually just begun. Believe me
column2: it is not fun. I am conscious that I havenâ€™t lived through really hard life experiences. I know I still have before me a long road. I have all the weight on my shoulders

But then God showed me - at least a piece of it - and I wasnâ€™t sure if I could handle itâ€¦ The world is kind of heavyâ€¦ Iâ€™m only 18... The real work is just beginningâ€¦ The tough life is still aheadâ€¦ What Iâ€™ve lived is nothing compared to what is waiting for meâ€¦ He never said it would be easy
column4: and His last words were â€œ I will give you the strength to do everything that you NEED to doâ€ - I thought of Mother Theresa once again

column1: The skies looked at her with a daring stare

column6: how couldnâ€™t she? Why did it have to be that way? Why did she have to be so lonely? Just because she couldnâ€™t do what the others could? She couldnâ€™t go where they would go. That was the end of the story. Trying to learn did not help
column7: but made it worse. Her pride was even wounded in the process.  In some of the intents she thought she had been close to loosing her life. Now a bench and a table kept her company. She sat sipping her cup of hot chocolate
column8: the only consolation she could get.

column1: She gazed at the immense white mountains
column2: so pure and beautiful. The atmosphere inspired peacefulness. A fresh scent filled the air. Yet her heart was in fire. And the beauty of the place did nothing to help her. Nothing but stare. She could not understand how she was surrounded by such beauty and was not able to enjoy it. Her eyes rejoiced but her soul screamed untamed. A pain wanting to crawl its way out
column3: caged inside her body. So many wonders put togetherâ€¦ The gorgeous sun shining on her face
column4: smiling. And all he got back from her was a frown.

column1: She had come from a far away land
column2: where the snow never touches the ground. Where the cold is just a breeze and just a rumor. She had never seen so much snow before
column3: and there it was: everywhereâ€¦ Like a fairy tale
column4: like shiny magic powder. The magic spread along the streets
column5: houses
column6: fields and mountains. She had also never felt so cold
column7: yet burning at the same time. This greatness was in front of her eyes and she couldnâ€™t help but wonder how she could feel so miserably unhappy. And so lonelyâ€¦ Even with the company of these amazing and impeccable mountains. Her eyes started to drown in her tears
column8: and as slow as a feather falls in the air
column9: fell one tear. The following drops laid on the table
column10: untouched. She did not look down
column11: but up to the sun
column12: asking him â€œWhy do I feel this way? Help me! Make me smile. Make me feel loved. Or at least
column13: accompanied.â€ Yet the sun silenced. Ignored her this time. Another voice
column14: the one of the wind
column15:
said: â€œLook down.â€ As she turned her head down she discovered a thin film on the table. Her tears had frozen. She broke them with her fingers and thought she would have never imagined anyone breaking a tear.Hadn't even held it as possible. She held the tiny pieces of tears on her hand. Gently closed her fist. She let those frozen tears put the fire out in her heart. She shut her eyes and said to herself: â€œTomorrowâ€¦ Tomorrow will be another day.â€ And she allowed her lungs to slowly breathe the fine air of peacefulness.

column1: Anita ya había ido a El Cielo en cinco ocasiones
column2: así que era nuestra experta guía principal. Marcos había acompañado al grupo de Anita en una ocasión
column3: y como hermano mayor coordinaba con liderazgo firme a los niños. El problema es que desde la mañana había estado nublado o lloviendo. Instalar las tiendas bajo la lluvia ligera no fue tanto el problema. Como casi toda la madera del lugar estaba completamente mojada
column4: tardamos más de dos horas en encender la fogata. Igualmente
column5: el conservarla encendida toda la noche fue todo un reto. Toda la familia se turnó en guardias de dos horas todo la noche (salvo Marcos que se quedaba cuatro horas) para velar y cuidar la fogata. La verdad que te sobrecoge el estar ahí en medio de la sierra
column6: en medio de la noche
column7: en medio de la nada (sí que piensas muchas cosas!). En la madrugada por fin se despejó el cielo
column8: permitiéndonos contemplar el más deslumbrante espectáculo de refulgentes estrellas.

column1: From then on the weather was perfect (salvo los implacables mosquitos
column2: pero eso es otro asunto). Después de desayunar todos se fueron camino arriba a explorar. Yo me quedé a cuidar (admito que estaba cansado
column3: además de que nunca hay qué dejar solo el campamento). Después de unas tres horas regresaron con nuevas aventuras
column4: fotos y más cansados. Siguió la comida
column5: baño en el arroyo de agua helada (I skiped
column6: though) y tarde de relax. Como no tuvimos oportunidad de ir a misa (oops!)
column7: plantaron una pequeña cruz junto a la fogata y celebramos una liturga de la palabra (mami llevaba el misal) en la que participamos todos. Fue un momento de oración muy especial en el que nos sentimos muy unidos y muy cerca de Dios y de su creación.

column1: Por la noche nos acostamos en el pasto sobre sleeping bags
column4: jugamos
column5: hicimos bromas y nos reímos mucho todos.

column4: cargar todas las cosas
column5: que aunque menos
column6: no eran tan pocas (si no
column7: pregúntenle a los niños
column8: que cargaron lo más pesado) y a emprender el camino de regreso al entronque con el camino de San José a Alta Cima
column9: donde nos esperaba Chabelo con la pick up para el regreso a Gómez Farías.

column1: Claro que habría más detalles qué comentar de nuestras aventuras en este lugar extraordinario
column2: pero quisiera mencionar también otras cosas con relación a nuestra familia: el que hayamos podido compartir esta comunión con la obra de nuestro Creador
column3: que nos deslumbra con su majestad; el que atravesemos juntos momentos difíciles
column4: incluso tal vez de cierto peligro
column5: que nos hacen sentirnos más unidos; la disposición para darnos la mano unos a otros
column6: a pesar de las diferencias que llegan a surgir; el asumir las situaciones que forjan el carácter
column7: como las incomodidades y el trabajo duro que hay qué hacer
column8: aceptando las cosas como vienen… maybe groaning sometimes
column9: but always willing to do what must be done.

column2: I'm so proud of my family… in Heaven (El Cielo) and everywhere.
